channel.title: Good News Network
channel.description: A Daily Dose of Positive News to Enthuse

item.title: Bulletproof, Fireproof, Eco-friendly Homes Are Made of Plastic Bottles
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
People from Africa to Latin America are recycling bottles and using them to build fireproof, bulletproof, environmentally-friendly homes. For about a quarter the cost of a conventional home, folks can build a two-bedroom house from 14,000 recycled plastic bottles by using the technique known as “bottle walls.” Teen’s Device to Clear Plastic

The post Bulletproof, Fireproof, Eco-friendly Homes Are Made of Plastic Bottles appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: 4 Year-old Advertises to be Flower Girl and Lands a Wedding at Courthouse
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
A four-year-old girl made a wish and her mom devised a brilliant plan to make it come true. It would involve a fancy dress, a basket of flowers, and a sign that read: “Can I be your flower girl?” Don’t worry. Her mother didn’t suggest she stand in the streets–not this

The post 4 Year-old Advertises to be Flower Girl and Lands a Wedding at Courthouse appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Arizona City Mandates All Dogs Sold in Pet Stores Will Come From Shelters
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
For the longest time, rescue groups, shelter volunteers, and animal lovers everywhere have hoped the day would come when pet stores would sell shelter pups exclusively, as a way to cut the profit from “puppy mills”. Last week a federal judge in Phoenix, Arizona upheld a city law requiring that

The post Arizona City Mandates All Dogs Sold in Pet Stores Will Come From Shelters appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Elderly Man’s Home is Repainted by Strangers After Kids Make Fun Of It
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
Leonard Bullock is one of those guys who sits on his porch every day. And a railroad track inspector named Josh Cyganik has made it a point to wave to the 75-year-old every day for four years. Josh and his fellow workers begin every day in the railroad yard across the street from Leonard’s

The post Elderly Man’s Home is Repainted by Strangers After Kids Make Fun Of It appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Stranger Works for Decades to Return Family’s Purple Heart Found in Trash
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
Tech Sergeant Wiljo Matalamaki never came home from World War II, but a medal recognizing his sacrifice made an incredible journey after it disappeared 49 years ago and finally–after decades of research by a compassionate stranger– made its way back to his family. Matalamaki received his Purple Heart—a medal given to

The post Stranger Works for Decades to Return Family’s Purple Heart Found in Trash appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Swipe Right For Unconditional Love: App Pairs You With Adoptable Pets
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
Wouldn’t it be nice if you knew that whoever you “swiped right” for would love you back, unconditionally? With the new AllPaws app, that nicety is a reality. The app, available for iPhone and iPad, helps prospective pet owners filter through adoptable pups and kittens in shelters across the U.S. and

The post Swipe Right For Unconditional Love: App Pairs You With Adoptable Pets appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: National S’mores Day: Animal Activists Now Have Vegan Marshmallows
item.dc:creator: Helaina Hovitz
item.description:
Vegans now have a gelatin-free marshmallow to celebrate with on National S’mores Day. Besides being vegan, Dandies are the first non-GMO verified marshmallows on the market, and are produced in a facility free of dairy, eggs, peanuts, tree-nuts, and, of course, gelatin. They are also free of artificial ingredients, high

The post National S’mores Day: Animal Activists Now Have Vegan Marshmallows appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 10
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
25 years ago today, the Magellan spacecraft successfully inserted itself into Venus’s orbit. Launched from a NASA Space Shuttle one year earlier, the 2282 lb robotic probe was sent to map the surface of Venus using radar and to collect other data. During its four years of service, Magellan was the

The post Good News in History, August 10 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Astronaut Reveals His 1969 Customs Form: Places Visited – “Moon”
item.dc:creator: Terry Turner
item.description:
46 years after men first walked on the moon, we are reminded that while rocket fuel powered the Apollo 11 spacecraft, governments still run on paperwork. Buzz Aldrin, the second man to walk on the moon, still has the US Customs form from his return trip back to Earth and

The post Astronaut Reveals His 1969 Customs Form: Places Visited – “Moon” appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Frances Kelsey: Hero Who Saved a Nation From Thalidomide (1914-2015)
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Tributes are hailing Frances Kelsey as a hero after her death at the age of 101 on Friday. The Canadian pharmacologist fought tenaciously in the 1960s as a medical officer for the Food and Drug Administration to keep the crippling drug thalidomide out of the U.S. market. The drug was

The post Frances Kelsey: Hero Who Saved a Nation From Thalidomide (1914-2015) appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Comfortable High Heels For Women Designed by Orthopedic Nurse
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Uncomfortable high heels in your closet may soon get the boot, once you’ve seen the innovative shoes by an orthopedic nurse turned Italian shoe designer. The defining step came for Julie Lopez at her daughter’s wedding when her feet, which have bunions, hurt so much she ended up going barefoot

The post Comfortable High Heels For Women Designed by Orthopedic Nurse appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Carbon Pollution From U.S. Power Plants Hits 27-Year Low
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Electric power plants in the US spewed 128 million metric tons of carbon dioxide in April 2015, the lowest for any month since April 1988, according a government report. The US Energy Information Administration said renewable energy generation increased by 2% in the first quarter, over the same period in

The post Carbon Pollution From U.S. Power Plants Hits 27-Year Low appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Denver Police Rewarding Law-abiding Citizens with Free Pizza
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Who doesn’t appreciate a pat on the back, now and then? In that spirit, the Denver Police Department launched an initiative aimed at acknowledging people and rewarding them with pizza gift cards for their courteous actions, for helping others and for obeying the law. On July 29, patrol officers downtown

The post Denver Police Rewarding Law-abiding Citizens with Free Pizza appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 9
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
On this day 85 years ago, the cartoon character Betty Boop made her first appearance. Created by Max Fleischer as a caricature of a Jazz age flapper for his animated Talkartoon series, she became one of the best-known and popular cartoon characters in the world. Watch a clip… (1930) (From

item.title: From Chemo Chair Man Raises $74K Tweeting for Stem Cell Charity
item.dc:creator: Sheila Key
item.description:
John Underwood knew he might someday need a bone-marrow transplant. Diagnosed with a rare form of lymphoma, Underwood said that his best shot at an eventual recovery will “probably” rest with  an organization whose mission is to recruit people willing to donate some of their stem cells. So, as he

The post From Chemo Chair Man Raises $74K Tweeting for Stem Cell Charity appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Record Number of Tourists Flocking to Greece Provide Needed Cash
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Despite the economic crisis in Greece that brought it to the brink of leaving the Euro–or perhaps because of it, in a show of support–millions of tourists are flocking to Athens providing a needed boost for local businesses. Aegean Airlines, Greece’s largest airline, told Reuters that passenger traffic was up

The post Record Number of Tourists Flocking to Greece Provide Needed Cash appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Victoria Police Officer Buys Plane Ticket to Reunite Senior with Family
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
A British Columbia police officer bought a plane ticket with his credit card for a disoriented senior so that she could be reunited with her family. Andre Almeida helped the woman, who was displaying dementia-like symptoms, after she disembarked from a cruise ship in Victoria and never returned. Victoria police

The post Victoria Police Officer Buys Plane Ticket to Reunite Senior with Family appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Beyond Ugly Protests, Germans Open Hearts and Homes for Refugees
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
Anti-refugee protests and arson attacks dominate German headlines, but countless unsung volunteers have been collecting clothing and household goods donated by Germans to distribute to some of the tens of thousands of asylum-seekers fleeing war. Community leader Wolfgang Esser also organizes youth soccer for the children of newcomers, saying, “Sport

The post Beyond Ugly Protests, Germans Open Hearts and Homes for Refugees appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Good News in History, August 8
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
On this day 45 years ago, shortly before her tragic death, Janis Joplin bought a gravestone for blues legend Bessie Smith, who was buried in an unmarked grave after she died in a car accident in 1937. Joplin often called Smith’s raspy blues voice her greatest inspiration. The marker, in Mount Lawn Cemetery in

The post Good News in History, August 8 appeared first on Good News Network.

item.title: Jon Stewart Says Goodbye to The Daily Show With A Little Help From Friends
item.dc:creator: Good News Network
item.description:
After 16 years at the helm of Comedy Central’s fake news program, The Daily Show, comedian Jon Stewart signed off yesterday during a special one-hour goodbye show. He was joined by ”senior correspondents” who had helped propel the show to number one among 18-35 year old viewers looking for satirical

The post Jon Stewart Says Goodbye to The Daily Show With A Little Help From Friends appeared first on Good News Network.
